summary: I haven't drawn anything other than for school in a while but today I was feeling like it so I drew @danielhowell because he is...
body:
I haven’t drawn anything other than for school in a while but today I was feeling like it so I drew @danielhowell because he is a big inspiration to me and the quote “Have The Courage To Exist” helped me through some dark times. Dan and @amazingphil both helped me a lot, when I was feeling down, I’d watch their videos to distract me from my thoughts and not worry about things too much.

All I want to say is: Thank You!

summary:
Way back in April I met these two guys at their first interactive introverts show in Brighton. 
At the time I had a deathly...
body:
Way back in April I met these two guys at their first interactive introverts show in Brighton.

At the time I had a deathly hallows transfer tattoo on my arm as I’d been wanting to get it done properly for years but between being terrified of needles and indecisive on exactly how I wanted it to look I kept putting it off.

Dan noticed it and said it was cool so I explained how it wasn’t actually real but I was thinking of finally getting it done and this was a little test for how it could look.

Phil was really encouraging saying how I would be alright if I did do it and when I said how long I’d been wanting it he said I should defiantly get it done.

Well at the start of September it finally happened and I couldn’t be happier with it! (My terrible lighting does not make it look as good as it is 😅)

Everyone was saying how getting a tattoo isn’t the same as getting an injection or having a blood test and for the most part I was fine. I made it through 45 minutes before I nearly passed out but the artist doing it was really nice and gave me as long as I needed before finishing the last few bits.

So if Phil or Dan somehow end up seeing this, I just wanted to say thanks for giving me that extra positivity and encouragement to finally get it done! ☺️☺️

And thanks to Chris at Skinned Alive Tattoo for designing and tattooing it!

Way back in April I met these two guys at their first interactive introverts show in Brighton.

At the time I had a deathly hallows transfer tattoo on my arm as I’d been wanting to get it done properly for years but between being terrified of needles and indecisive on exactly how I wanted it to look I kept putting it off.

Dan noticed it and said it was cool so I explained how it wasn’t actually real but I was thinking of finally getting it done and this was a little test for how it could look.

Phil was really encouraging saying how I would be alright if I did do it and when I said how long I’d been wanting it he said I should defiantly get it done.

Well at the start of September it finally happened and I couldn’t be happier with it! (My terrible lighting does not make it look as good as it is 😅)

Everyone was saying how getting a tattoo isn’t the same as getting an injection or having a blood test and for the most part I was fine. I made it through 45 minutes before I nearly passed out but the artist doing it was really nice and gave me as long as I needed before finishing the last few bits.

So if Phil or Dan somehow end up seeing this, I just wanted to say thanks for giving me that extra positivity and encouragement to finally get it done! ☺️☺️

And thanks to Chris at Skinned Alive Tattoo for designing and tattooing it!
